main_definition: Just means something that is fair, rightful or only now happening or occurring.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Rightfully done without any mistake; correct and accurate.
meanings_and_examples.example: I just completed my homework correctly.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Only; at this moment or recently happened.
meanings_and_examples.example: It's just me who came to the party today.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Exclusively; without others involved or included.
meanings_and_examples.example: He is just my brother, not my father.
I'll help you with your project right now (just).

meanings_and_examples.definition: Equitable and fair; in accordance with moral principles or the law.
meanings_and_examples.example: The judge ruled justly, considering all evidence.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Purely; without any impurities or other additives.
meanings_and_examples.example: She made a just dessert of his misdeeds by treating him poorly.
